circle_bundles.build_bundle

circle_bundles.build_bundle(data, cover, *, total_metric=None, cc='pca2', min_patch_size=10, weights=None, min_points_edge=5, ref_angle=0.0, delta_min_points=5, compute_witness=False, show=False, verbose=None)[source]

Build a discrete circle bundle from data over a specified base-space cover.

This is the core end-to-end pipeline:

  1. ensure/build the cover (membership matrix U and partition of unity pou),

  2. compute local circle coordinates on each chart (local trivialization),

  3. estimate O(2) transition functions on overlaps,

  4. compute quality diagnostics, and

  5. compute characteristic class representatives (e.g. SW1/Euler-type data when available).

Parameters:

  • data (ndarray) – Data array of shape (n_samples, ambient_dim) representing points in the total space.

  • cover – Cover object over the base space. Must provide (after cover.build()): U (membership matrix), pou (partition of unity), and nerve accessors. If U/pou are missing, this function calls cover.build().

  • total_metric – Optional metric used by local trivialization routines (when they support it). If omitted, routines typically default to Euclidean behavior.

  • cc (object) – Local circle-coordinate method/config. Common choices include: - "pca2" for a fast PCA-based circle coordinate method, or - a Dreimac configuration object, or - a custom callable implementing your CC interface.

  • min_patch_size (int) – Minimum number of points required in a chart to attempt local trivialization. Charts with fewer points are treated as failures.

  • weights – Optional per-sample or per-overlap weights used in transition estimation (implementation-defined; pass only if you know the expected format).

  • min_points_edge (int) – Minimum number of overlap points required to fit a transition on an edge. Overlaps with fewer points are treated as errors.

  • ref_angle (float) – Reference angle (in radians) used to fix reflection conventions in O(2) fitting.

  • delta_min_points (int) – Minimum number of points used by certain consistency/quality checks on simplices.

  • compute_witness (bool) – If True, compute witness-based diagnostics (may be slower).

  • show (bool) – If True, display a summary visualization after construction.

  • verbose (bool | None) – If True, print status messages during construction. Defaults to show.

Returns:

A BundleResult packaging the cover, local trivialization, transitions, diagnostics, characteristic classes, and convenience methods.

Return type:

bundle

Raises:

ValueError: – If local trivialization fails on any chart or if required overlaps are missing.
